page.title: 11Flood prevention.
page.content: Battlesbridge is on the North bank of the River Crouch and is below the 8m. contour line.This part of Essex was flooded in the 1953 floods.Existing sea defences are a minimum of 6.7 metres high.The average high tide is 5.4 metres though Spring level in July 1985 was 5.8 metres.This gives 90cms of safety.There have been several floods during the last 10 years,caused by surge tides;a trough of low pressure in the channel draws water in to a hump making tides higher.Should a major flood occur the station would be safe though the antique centre,church, garage and Hawk Inn would be flooded. Farmland near the river is mostly pasture so would suffer little. The concrete defences need some reinforcement. Residents do not fear another flood.
